venue.name: The New Eden Community Organic Garden

item.description:
The New Eden Community Organic Garden at the First Parish Church in Newbury will be hosting a workshop for the NOFA/Mass third annual Statewide Spring Organic Gardening Day.

From their website: http://www.newedengar...

This Spring, just as it comes time to plant the garden, NOFA/Mass presents Their third annual Statewide Spring Organic Gardening Day. On April 10, there will be organic gardening workshops in every region of the state including the New Eden Collaborative of First Parish Church). The New Eden workshop will be taught byRita Wollmering and Brooke Finn, co-owners of The HERB FARMacy – a 10 acre certified organic farm and retail greenhouse operation, growing herbs, flowers, and veggies. Rita and Brooke will cover all aspects of organic gardening, including companion planting, heirloom varieties, and resources. Focus is on MA growing conditions, using first-hand experience and they will use the New Eden Garden for demonstrations.

Whether you are a complete newcomer to gardening or you just feel that you could use some brushing up on growing skills and concepts, this workshop is for you.

Fee : $30. NOFA membership discount: $5. Early registration (by March 27, 2010) discount: $5.

Registration and payment for this workshop are through NOFA/Mass
http://www.nofamass.o...
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the gardens out back
item.name: NOFA Organic Gardening Workshop Day
